markdownRemark.html:
Hi Friends üëã,

Welcome To aGuideHub! ‚ù§Ô∏è

To convert int to string in golang, use thestrconv.Itoa() method it will return int as a string. You have to just call it like strconv.Itoa(v).

Important Points

Difference between int and uint

UInt does not allow for negative numbers.

uint‚Äôs and int‚Äôs max value

uint8  : 0 to 255 
uint16 : 0 to 65535 
uint32 : 0 to 4294967295 
uint64 : 0 to 18446744073709551615 
int8   : -128 to 127 
int16  : -32768 to 32767 
int32  : -2147483648 to 2147483647 
int64  : -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807

Follow the below tutorial if you are struggling with installing GO in windows.

https://aguidehub.com/blog/how-to-install-golang-in-windows

Today, I will show you how do I convert int to string in golang, as mentioned above I‚Äôm going to use the Itoa() method which is provided by the strconv package.

Let‚Äôs start our Golang convert int to string example

main.go

package main

import (
    "strconv"
    "fmt"
    "reflect"
)

func main() {
    t := strconv.Itoa(123)
    fmt.Println(t)
    fmt.Println(reflect.TypeOf(t))
}

In the above example, we have converted the int value to a string and printed in golang console. let‚Äôs check the output.

Output

123
string

I hope it helps you, All the best üëç.

Try it Yourself
